sen.j: 斯波 義廉（しば よしかど、生没年不詳）は室町時代中後期の守護大名である。
sen.e: Yoshikado SHIBA (date of birth and death unknown) was a shugo daimyo (a Japanese provincial military governor who became a feudal lord) in the mid to late Muromachi period.
Yoshikado SHIBA (date of birth and death unknown) was a shugo daimyo (a Japanese provincial military governor who became a feudal lord) in the mid to late Muromachi period.
Yoshikado SHIBA (date of birth and death unknown) was a shugo daimyo (a Japanese provincial military governor who became a feudal lord) in the mid to late Muromachi period.

sen.j: 室町幕府の管領。
sen.e: He was the kanrei (shogun's deputy).
He was the kanrei (shogun's deputy).
He was the kanrei (shogun's deputy).

sen.j: 本姓は源氏。
sen.e: His original surname was Genji.
His original surname was Genji.
His original surname was Genji.

sen.j: 家系は清和源氏の一家系 河内源氏の流れにて足利氏の一門渋川氏に生まれた。
sen.e: Yoshikado SHIBA was born to the Shibukawa clan, a branch of the Ashikaga clan which was descended from Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) and Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshikado SHIBA was born to the Shibukawa clan, a branch of the Ashikaga clan which was descended from Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) and Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).
Yoshikado SHIBA was born to the Shibukawa clan, a branch of the Ashikaga clan which was descended from Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) and Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 後に同じく足利一門の斯波氏を相続した。
sen.e: Later, Yoshikado succeeded to the Shiba clan, a part of the Ashikaga clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later, Yoshikado succeeded to the Shiba clan, a part of the Ashikaga clan.
Later, Yoshikado succeeded to the Shiba clan, a part of the Ashikaga clan.

sen.j: 父は堀越公方・足利政知に随身して武蔵国に随行した関東探題渋川義鏡。
sen.e: His father was Yoshikane SHIBUKAWA, a Kanto tandai (a high-ranking official with governmental, judiciary or military responsibilities within the Kanto region), who accompanied Masatomo ASHIKAGA, Horigoe Kubo (the shogunal deputy based in Horigoe, Izu Province), to Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His father was Yoshikane SHIBUKAWA, a Kanto tandai (a high-ranking official with governmental, judiciary or military responsibilities within the Kanto region), who accompanied Masatomo ASHIKAGA, Horigoe Kubo (the shogunal deputy based in Horigoe, Izu Province), to Musashi Province.

His father was Yoshikane SHIBUKAWA, a Kanto tandai (a high-ranking official with governmental, judiciary or military responsibilities within the Kanto region), who accompanied Masatomo ASHIKAGA, Horigoe Kubo (the shogunal deputy based in Horigoe, Izu Province), to Musashi Province.

sen.j: 母は山名氏一族の娘とも。
sen.e: It is said that his mother was a daughter of the Yamana clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that his mother was a daughter of the Yamana clan.
It is said that his mother was a daughter of the Yamana clan.

sen.j: 妻は山名宗全の娘、朝倉孝景 (7代当主)の娘。
sen.e: He had two wives, Sozen YAMANA's daughter and Takaage ASAKURA (the seventh family head of the ASAKURA clan) 's daughter.
He had two wives, Sozen YAMANA's daughter and Takakage ASAKURA (the seventh family head of the ASAKURA clan) 's daughter.
He had two wives, Sozen YAMANA's daughter and Takakage ASAKURA (the seventh family head of the ASAKURA clan) 's daughter.

sen.j: 官位は治部大輔、左兵衛佐。
sen.e: His official rank was Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration) and Sahyoe no suke (Deputy of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards).
His official rank was Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration) and Sahyoe no suke (Deputy of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards).
His official rank was Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration) and Sahyoe no suke (Deputy of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards).

tit.e: Succession to the head of the clan
Succession to the head of the clan
Succession to the head of the clan

sen.j: 長禄3年（1459年）、斯波氏の当主・斯波義敏は家臣の守護代甲斐常治と対立し、8代将軍足利義政の怒りに触れて罷免される。
sen.e: In 1459, Yoshitoshi SHIBA, the head of the Shiba clan, was removed from his position as head of the clan by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, the 8th shogun of the Ashikaga shogunate who was angry about the conflict between Yoshitoshi and Jochi KAI, the shugodai (deputy military governor) and the vassal of the SHIBA clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1459, Yoshitoshi SHIBA, the head of the Shiba clan, was removed from his position as head of the clan by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, the 8th shogun of the Ashikaga shogunate who was angry about the conflict between Yoshitoshi and Jochi KAI, the shugodai (deputy military governor) and the vassal of the SHIBA clan.

In 1459, Yoshitoshi SHIBA, the head of the Shiba clan, was removed from his position as head of the clan by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, the 8th shogun of the Ashikaga shogunate who was angry about the conflict between Yoshitoshi and Jochi KAI, the shugodai (deputy military governor) and the vassal of the SHIBA clan.

sen.j: よって実子斯波義寛が家督を相続する。
sen.e: Yoshihiro SHIBA, Yoshitoshi's son, succeeded him as the head of the clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshihiro SHIBA, Yoshitoshi's son, succeeded him as the head of the clan.
Yoshihiro SHIBA, Yoshitoshi's son, succeeded him as the head of the clan.

sen.j: 松王丸ものちに廃され、義廉は斯波氏と同じ足利氏の一門にて、かつ曾祖母が斯波義将の息女である縁から、寛正2年（1461年）、義政の命により、斯波氏の家督を継承する。
sen.e: In 1461, after Matsuomaru was disinherited, Yoshikado succeeded him as the head of the Shiba clan by order of the shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA as he descended from the Ashikaga clan as well as the Shiba clan, and his great-grandmother was the daughter of Yoshiyuki SHIBA.
sen.cmt: 松王丸の説明が無いため、 (Yoshihiro's childhood name) を補足するのが良いと思われます。
sen.e: In 1461, after Matsuomaru was disinherited, Yoshikado succeeded him as the head of the Shiba clan by order of the shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA as he descended from the Ashikaga clan as well as the Shiba clan, and his great-grandmother was the daughter of Yoshiyuki SHIBA.

In 1461, after Matsuomaru was disinherited, Yoshikado succeeded him as the head of the Shiba clan by order of the shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA as he descended from the Ashikaga clan as well as the Shiba clan, and his great-grandmother was the daughter of Yoshiyuki SHIBA.

sen.j: このとき、尾張国・越前国・遠江国の守護も兼ねている。
sen.e: He was also the shugo (military governor) of Owari-no-kuni, Echizen-no-kuni, and Totomi-no-kuni Province.
He was also the shugo (military governor) of Owari Province, Echizen Province and Totomi Province.
He was also the shugo (military governor) of Owari Province, Echizen Province and Totomi Province.

sen.j: 文正元年（1466年）9月、義政生母の死去による大赦で義敏が赦免され、義敏は周防の大内教弘の支援を得て巻き返しを図る。
sen.e: Having been pardoned by amnesty due to the death of Yoshimasa's mother, Yoshitoshi tried to stage a comeback with the support of Norihiro OUCHI, the governor of Suo Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Having been pardoned by amnesty due to the death of Yoshimasa's mother, Yoshitoshi tried to stage a comeback with the support of Norihiro OUCHI, the governor of Suo Province.
Having been pardoned by amnesty due to the death of Yoshimasa's mother, Yoshitoshi tried to stage a comeback with the support of Norihiro OUCHI, the governor of Suo Province.

sen.j: 京都で義政と対面し、義政は政所執事伊勢貞親らの進言もあり、裁定で義廉に義敏への三ヶ国の守護返還を命じる。
sen.e: He had a meeting with Yoshimasa in Kyoto and Yoshimasa, in September 1466, ordered Yoshikado to return Yoshitoshi to the position of the shugo (military governor) of the three provinces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He had a meeting with Yoshimasa in Kyoto and Yoshimasa, in September 1466, ordered Yoshikado to return Yoshitoshi to the position of the shugo (military governor) of the three provinces.
He had a meeting with Yoshimasa in Kyoto and Yoshimasa ordered Yoshikado to return Yoshitoshi to the position of the shugo (military governor) of the three provinces.
sen.cmt: チェッカーのコメントどおり、原文には年月がないので、削除しました。

sen.j: 娘婿の山名宗全らは義廉を支持し、このため義敏は管領の細川勝元を頼った。
sen.e: As Sozen YAMANA, Yoshikado's son-in-law, supported Yoshikado, Yoshitoshi had Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, the kanrei (shogun's deputy) on his side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As Sozen YAMANA, Yoshikado's son-in-law, supported Yoshikado, Yoshitoshi had Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, the kanrei (shogun's deputy) on his side.
As Sozen YAMANA, Yoshikado's son-in-law, supported Yoshikado, Yoshitoshi had Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, the kanrei (shogun's deputy) on his side.

sen.j: 斯波氏の争いは足利将軍家の家督争いや畠山氏の争いと関係して応仁の乱の原因の1つにもなる。
sen.e: The conflict in the SHIBA clan was one of the factors that caused the Onin War, in connection with the succession dispute in the ASHIKAGA shogun's clan and the dispute in the HATAKEYAMA clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The conflict in the SHIBA clan was one of the factors that caused the Onin War, in connection with the succession dispute in the ASHIKAGA shogun's clan and the dispute in the HATAKEYAMA clan.
The conflict in the SHIBA clan was one of the factors that caused the Onin War, in connection with the succession dispute in the ASHIKAGA shogun's clan and the dispute in the HATAKEYAMA clan.

sen.j: 義敏は応仁の乱文正の政変で失脚し、応仁元年（1467年）正月に義廉は畠山政長の辞意により、後任として管領に就任。
sen.e: Through Yoshitoshi's downfall in the Bunsho Coup during the Onin War, Yoshikado assumed the position of the kanrei (shogun's deputy) in February 1467 after the resignation of Masanaga HATAKEYAMA.
Through Yoshitoshi's downfall in the Bunsho Coup during the Onin War, Yoshikado assumed the position of the kanrei (shogun's deputy) in February 1467 after the resignation of Masanaga HATAKEYAMA.
Through Yoshitoshi's downfall in the Bunsho Coup during the Onin War, Yoshikado assumed the position of the kanrei (shogun's deputy) in February 1467 after the resignation of Masanaga HATAKEYAMA.

tit.j: 応仁の乱とその後の義廉
tit.e: The Onin War and Yoshikado after the war
The Onin War and Yoshikado after the war
The Onin War and Yoshikado after the war

sen.j: 応仁元年（1467年）5月、京都市街において応仁の乱がはじまる。
sen.e: In June 1467, the Onin War began in Kyoto City.
In June 1467, the Onin War began in Kyoto City.
In June 1467, the Onin War began in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 義廉は山名宗全率いる西軍に属して各地に転戦する。
sen.e: Yoshikado, who belonged to the western army led by Sozen YAMANA, fought in different places.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshikado, who belonged to the western army led by Sozen YAMANA, fought in different places.
Yoshikado, who belonged to the western army led by Sozen YAMANA, fought in different places.

sen.j: 文明 (日本)3年（1471年）に有力家臣の一人である朝倉孝景 (7代当主)が東軍に属し、幕府から追討を受ける。
sen.e: In 1471, Takakage ASAKURA (the seventh family head of the Asakura clan), one of the powerful vassals, went over to the eastern army, and the bakufu (Japanese shogun-led feudal government) hunted him down.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1471, Takakage ASAKURA (the seventh family head of the Asakura clan), one of the powerful vassals, went over to the eastern army, and the bakufu (Japanese shogun-led feudal government) hunted him down.

In 1471, Takakage ASAKURA (the seventh family head of the Asakura clan), one of the powerful vassals, went over to the eastern army, and the bakufu (Japanese shogun-led feudal government) hunted him down.

sen.j: 文明7年（1475年）、尾張上四群の織田敏広に擁立されて尾張へ下国する。
sen.e: Having had support from Toshihiro ODA, the governor of Owari-no-kamishigun, Yoshikado left for the minor province of Owari.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処尾張上四群の「群」は「郡」と思われます。尾張上四郡と尾張下四郡の正式な読み方が不明のため、それぞれOwari-no-kamishigunとOwari-no-shimoshigunの読みを当てました。
sen.e: Having had support from Toshihiro ODA, the governor of Owari-no-kamishigun, Yoshikado left for the minor province of Owari.
Having had support from Toshihiro ODA, the governor of Owari-no-kamishigun, Yoshikado left for the minor province of Owari.

sen.j: 東軍に組した尾張下四郡守護代の織田敏定の勢力を一時同国から駆逐する。
sen.e: He drove Toshisada ODA, the governor of Owari-no-shimoshigun who belonged to the eastern army, and his followers out of Owari-no-shimoshigun for a period of time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He drove Toshisada ODA, the governor of Owari-no-shimoshigun who belonged to the eastern army, and his followers out of Owari-no-shimoshigun for a period of time.
He drove Toshisada ODA, the governor of Owari-no-shimoshigun who belonged to the eastern army, and his followers out of Owari-no-shimoshigun for a period of time.

sen.j: しかし、文明10年（1478年）、敏定が室町幕府から「凶徒退治」を命じられ下国すると、支持勢力を失い、その後の行方は不明となる。
sen.e: However, in 1478, when Toshisada was exiled to a minor province by the Muromachi bakufu, he lost his supporters and went missing.
sen.cmt: 「凶徒退治」は定訳不明のため、「下国する」と合わせて、was exiled としました。
sen.e: However, in 1478, when Toshisada was exiled to a minor province by the Muromachi bakufu, he lost his supporters and went missing.
However, in 1478, when Toshisada was exiled to a minor province by the Muromachi bakufu, he lost his supporters and went missing.

sen.j: 朝倉氏の推戴により、息子の一人義俊が室町将軍家の連枝にあたる鞍谷氏・足利氏を継ぐこととなる。
sen.e: Under the authority of the Asakura clan, Yoshitoshi, one of Yoshikado's sons succeeded as the head of both the Kuratani clan and the Ashikaga clan, which are descended from the Muromachi shogunate family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 原文では「息子の一人」とありますが、義俊は一人息子だったと思われます。よって、訳文のone of Yoshikado's sonsよりもYoshikado's sonとすべきかと思います。
sen.e: Under the authority of the Asakura clan, Yoshitoshi, one of Yoshikado's sons succeeded as the head of both the Kuratani clan and the Ashikaga clan, which are descended from the Muromachi shogunate family.

Under the authority of the Asakura clan, Yoshitoshi, one of Yoshikado's sons succeeded as the head of both the Kuratani clan and the Ashikaga clan, which are descended from the Muromachi shogunate family.

sen.j: 名目上の越前の国主とされたので越前に移り住んだという説が有力視されている。
sen.e: There is a strong view that he moved to Echizen Province as he was the nominal sovereign of the region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a strong view that he moved to Echizen Province as he was the nominal sovereign of the region.
There is a strong view that he moved to Echizen Province as he was the nominal sovereign of the region.

sen.j: 官職および位階等の履歴
sen.e: Records of Yoshikado's government posts and court ranks
Records of Yoshikado's government posts and court ranks
Records of Yoshikado's government posts and court ranks

sen.j: ※日付は旧暦
sen.e: *Japan's old lunisolar calendar is used for the dates shown below.
*Japan's old lunisolar calendar is used for the dates shown below.
*Japan's old lunisolar calendar is used for the dates shown below.

sen.j: 1461年（長禄4年）2月、家督を相続し、越前・尾張・遠江の三国守護に就任。
sen.e: In March, 1461 - succeeded as the head of the Shiba clan and assumed the governorship of the three provinces: Echizen, Owari and Totomi.
In March, 1461 - succeeded as the head of the Shiba clan and assumed the governorship of the three provinces: Echizen, Owari and Totomi.
In March, 1461 - succeeded as the head of the Shiba clan and assumed the governorship of the three provinces: Echizen, Owari and Totomi.

sen.j: 1466年（文正元）7月、罷免される。
sen.e: In August 1466 - dismissed as the head of the three provinces.
In August 1466 - dismissed as the head of the three provinces.
In August 1466 - dismissed as the head of the three provinces.

sen.j: 1466年（文正元）9月、再び家督相続。
sen.e: In October 1466 - succeeded again to the position of the family head.
In October 1466 - succeeded again to the position of the family head.
In October 1466 - succeeded again to the position of the family head.

sen.j: 越前・尾張・遠江の三国守護に復帰
sen.e: Returned as the governor of the three provinces: Echizen, Owari and Totomi.
Returned as the governor of the three provinces: Echizen, Owari and Totomi.
Returned as the governor of the three provinces: Echizen, Owari and Totomi.

sen.j: 1467年（文正2）1月8日、幕府の管領となる。
sen.e: On February 21, 1467 - became the kanrei (shogun's deputy).
On February 21, 1467 - became the kanrei (shogun's deputy) of the bakufu.
On February 21, 1467 - became the kanrei (shogun's deputy) of the bakufu.

sen.j: 同年改元し、応仁元年5月、左兵衛佐に遷任。
sen.e: In June 1467 - transferred and held the position of Sahyoe no suke (Deputy of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards).
In June 1467 - transferred and held the position of Sahyoe no suke (Deputy of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards).
In June 1467 - transferred and held the position of Sahyoe no suke (Deputy of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards).

sen.j: 1468年（応仁2）7月15日、管領退任。
sen.e: On August 12, 1468 - resigned as the kanrei.
On August 12, 1468 - resigned as the kanrei.
On August 12, 1468 - resigned as the kanrei.
